enWisdom: Boldness [and defiance] in front of the king is the quickest [means of] destruction

Wisdom: مَنِ اجْتَرَأَ عَلَى السُّلْطَانِ فَقَدْ تَعَرَّضَ لِلْهَوَانِ
enWisdom: One who boldly [and defiantly] faces the ruler becomes vulnerable to disgrace
Being independent of [and not seeking anything from] kings is the best kingship
One whose competence is good is loved by his sovereign

Wisdom: مَنْ تَشَاغَلَ بِالسُّلْطَانِ لَمْ يَتَفَرَّغْ لِلْإِخْوَانِ
enWisdom: One who is occupied with [serving] the king will not [have time to] attend to his brothers
Disputing with kings takes away blessings

Wisdom: لَا تَصَدَّعُوا عَلَى سُلْطَانِكُمْ فَتَذُمُّوا غِبَّ أَمْرِكُمْ
enWisdom: Do not separate from your [rightful] ruler, thereby making the consequence of your affair blameworthy

Wisdom: لَا تَلْتَبِسْ بِالسُّلْطَانِ فِي وَقْتِ اضْطِرَابِ الْأُمُورِ عَلَيْهِ فَإِنَّ الْبَحْرَ لَا يَكَادُ يَسْلَمُ مِنْهُ رَاكِبُهُ مَعَ سُكُونِهِ فَكَيْفَ مَعَ اخْتِلَافِ رِيَاحِهِ وَاضْطِرَابِ أَمْوَاجِهِ
enWisdom: Do not associate with the king in times of disturbance and upheaval, for indeed the sea is such that even when it is calm, the seafarer barely manages to remain safe in it, so how would he fare with its turbulent winds and the tumultuous waves?!
Evil is the symbol of destruction
The greatest misdeed is recommending the vicious
Recommendation of the evil ones is one of the greatest sins
Increased wickedness is [a sign of] vileness and abjectness

Wisdom: مَنْ أَسَّسَ أَسَاسَ الشَّرِّ أَسَّسَهُ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: One who lays the foundation of evil cause has [actually] instituted it against himself
Adversity is a reproach

Wisdom: الْإِصَابَةُ سَلَامَةٌ الْخَطَاءُ مَلَامَةٌ الْعَجَلُ نَدَامَةٌ
enWisdom: Being right is [a means of] safety, erring is [a cause of] reproach and haste is [a reason for] regret
Many a person who is reproached has done nothing wrong
Too much reprimand indicates [one’s] suspicion

Wisdom: كَثْرَةُ التَّقْرِيعِ تُوغِرُ الْقُلُوبَ وَتُوحِشُ الْأَصْحَابَ
enWisdom: Too much reproof instils hatred in the hearts and alienates the companions

Wisdom: لَا تُكْثِرَنَّ الْعِتَابَ فَإِنَّهُ يُورِثُ الضَّغِينَةَ يَدْعُو إِلَى الْبَغْضَاءِ وَاسْتَعْتِبْ لِمَنْ رَجَوْتَ إِعْتَابَهُ
enWisdom: Never be excessive in reprimanding, for indeed it brings about ill feelings and calls toward hatred; and seek to appease the one whom you hope to reprimand
Whoever taunts others for something is himself affected by it
Neglect is an affliction of the capable
Be wary of neglect for verily it causes censure
The fruit of neglect is censure
An ignorant person is never found to be anything but falling short or excessive
When the outward gets corrupted, the inward also get corrupted

Wisdom: لِكُلِّ ظَاهِرٍ بَاطِنٌ عَلَى مِثَالِهِ فَمَنْ طَابَ ظَاهِرُهُ طَابَ بَاطِنُهُ وَمَا خَبُثَ ظَاهِرُهُ خَبُثَ بَاطِنُهُ
enWisdom: For every exterior there is a hidden interior that is like it, so one who’s exterior is good his interior is also good, and whoever has a bad exterior has a bad interior
How good a guidance having a good mien is!

Wisdom: الْإِصَابَةُ سَلَامَةٌ الْخَطَاءُ مَلَامَةٌ الْعَجَلُ نَدَامَةٌ
enWisdom: Being right is [a means of] safety, erring is [a cause of] reproach and haste is [a reason for] regret
Antipathy is a disgrace and sinning is [a cause of] destruction
People are fine as long as they are dissimilar from one another
The noble-minded person feigns inattention and pretends to be deceived
The noble-minded person makes [his] ownership righteous
The glance is the scout of temptations
Being occupied with the transient is a waste of time
A beautiful remembrance is one of the two lives
A beautiful remembrance is one of the two lifetimes
Travelling is one of the two torments
The prison is one of the two [types of] graves
A beautiful home is one of the two Paradises

Wisdom: النَّاسُ كَصُوَرٍ فِي الصَّحِيفَةِ كُلَّمَا طُوِيَ بَعْضُهَا نَشَرَ بَعْضُهَا
enWisdom: People are like writings on a scroll [of parchment], whenever part of it is rolled up, another part of it is unrolled

Wisdom: النَّاسُ كَالشَّجَرِ [كَالشَّجَرَةِ] شَرَابُهُ وَاحِدٌ وَثَمَرُهُ مُخْتَلِفٌ
enWisdom: People are like trees, their drink is one but their fruits are different

Wisdom: اسْتَقْبِحْ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ مَا تَسْتَقْبِحُهُ مِنْ غَيْرِكَ وَارْضَ لِلنَّاسِ [مِنَ النَّاسِ‏] بِمَا تَرْضَاهُ لِنَفْسِكَ
enWisdom: Loathe from yourself what you loathe from others and like for people what you like for yourself

Wisdom: اجْعَلْ نَفْسَكَ مِيزَاناً بَيْنَكَ وَبَيْنَ غَيْرِكَ وَأَحِبَّ [أَحْبِبْ‏] لَهُ مَا تُحِبُّ لِنَفْسِكَ وَاكْرَهْ لَهُ مَا تَكْرَهُ لَهَا وَأَحْسِنْ كَمَا تُحِبُّ أَنْ يُحْسَنَ إِلَيْكَ وَلَا تَظْلِمْ كَمَا تُحِبُّ أَنْ لَا تُظْلَمَ
enWisdom: Make your self a gauge between you and the other; love for him what you love for your self, and hate for him what you hate for it, and do good as you would like good to be done to you, and do not oppress just as you would like not to be oppressed

Wisdom: أَحْسِنْ رِعَايَةَ الْحُرُمَاتِ وَأَقْبِلْ عَلَى أَهْلِ الْمُرُوءَاتِ فَإِنَّ رِعَايَةَ الْحُرُمَاتِ تَدُلُّ عَلَى كَرَمِ الشِّيمَةِ وَالْإِقْبَالَ عَلَى ذَوِي الْمُرُوءَاتِ يُعْرِبُ عَنْ شَرَفِ الْهِمَّةِ
enWisdom: Guard well the sanctities [of such things that are sacrosanct] and draw near to the people of magnanimity, for indeed guarding the sanctities [and boundaries] demonstrates an honourable character and drawing near to the magnanimous indicates nobility of purpose

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالِاسْتِيثَارَ بِمَا لِلنَّاسِ فِيهِ أُسْوَةٌ وَالتَّغَابِيَ عَمَّا وَضَحَ لِلنَّاظِرِينَ [وضع لعيون الناضرين‏] فَإِنَّهُ مَأْخُوذٌ مِنْكَ لِغَيْرِكَ
enWisdom: Beware of reserving for yourself (or concealing) that which all the people have an equal right to and turning a blind eye to what is manifest for the onlookers otherwise it will surely be taken from you and given to someone else

Wisdom: أَعْرَفُ النَّاسِ بِالزَّمَانِ مَنْ لَمْ يَتَعَجَّبْ مِنْ أَحْدَاثِهِ
enWisdom: The person most cognizant of his age is the one who is not astonished by its events

Wisdom: إِنَّ لَيْلَكَ وَنَهَارَكَ لَا يَسْتَوْعِبَانِ لِجَمِيعِ حَاجَاتِكَ فَاقْسِمْهَا بَيْنَ عَمَلِكَ وَرَاحَتِكَ
enWisdom: Verily your night and day are not enough to meet all your needs, so divide them between your work and your relaxation
Verily nobility is nothing but the shunning of disgraceful actions

Wisdom: إِذَا قَلَّتِ الْمَقْدُرَةُ كَثُرَ التَّعَلُّلُ بِالْمَعَاذِيرِ
enWisdom: When [one’s] capability is reduced, the offering of excuses increases

Wisdom: إِذَا لَمْ يَكُنْ مَا تُرِيدُ فَلَا تُبَلْ كَيْفَ كُنْتَ
enWisdom: When what you want does not happen, then do not fret about how you were [and be satisfied with the decree of Allah]

Wisdom: جَعَلَ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ حُقُوقَ عِبَادِهِ مُقَدِّمَةً لِحُقُوقِهِ [عَلَى حُقُوقِهِ‏] فَمَنْ قَامَ بِحُقُوقِ عِبَادِ اللَّهِ كَانَ ذَلِكَ مُؤَدِّياً إِلَى الْقِيَامِ بِحُقُوقِ اللَّهِ
enWisdom: Allah, the Glorified, has placed the rights of His servants before His rights, so whoever fulfils the rights of the servants of Allah, then this helps one to fulfil the rights of Allah

Wisdom: حُسْنُ الِاخْتِيَارِ وَاصْطِنَاعُ الْأَحْرَارِ وَفَضْلُ الِاسْتِظْهَارِ مِنْ دَلَائِلِ الْإِقْبَالِ
enWisdom: Making a good choice, doing good to the freemen and taking adequate precaution [or support] are from the signs of turning [to Allah]

Wisdom: حَدِيثُ كُلِّ مَجْلِسٍ يُطْوَى مَعَ بِسَاطِهِ
enWisdom: The speech of every gathering is [supposed to be] rolled up with its carpet

Wisdom: خَوْضُ النَّاسِ فِي الشَّيْ‏ءِ مُقَدِّمَةُ الْكَائِنِ
enWisdom: The entry of people into [discussion about] a thing is the prelude to its [coming into] existence

Wisdom: خَمْسَةٌ يَنْبَغِي أَنْ يُهَانُوا الدَّاخِلُ بَيْنَ اثْنَيْنِ لَمْ يُدْخِلَاهُ فِي أَمْرِهِمَا وَالْمُتَأَمِّرُ عَلَى صَاحِبِ الْبَيْتِ فِي بَيْتِهِ وَالْمُتَقَدِّمُ عَلَى مَائِدَةٍ لَمْ يُدْعَ إِلَيْهَا وَالْمُقْبِلُ بِحَدِيثِهِ عَلَى غَيْرِ مُسْتَمِعٍ وَالْجَالِسُ فِي الْمَجَالِسِ الَّتِي لَا يَسْتَحِقُّهَا
enWisdom: Five [types of people] are worthy of being humiliated: The one who interferes between two people when they have not involved him in their affair, the one who issues commands to the owner of the house [while] in his house, the one who approaches a dining table when he has not been invited to do so, the one who continues talking when nobody is listening and the one who sits in the place where he has no right to sit
Sometimes the blind one arrives at his goal
Sometimes the powerless one acquires what he needs
Pleasing the obstinate one is a goal that cannot be attained

Wisdom: سِتَّةٌ لَا يُمَارَوْنَ الْفَقِيهُ وَالرَّئِيسُ وَالدَّنِيُّ وَالْبَذِيُّ وَالْمَرْأَةُ وَالصَّبِيُّ
enWisdom: One should not dispute with six types of people: the jurist, the leader, the low, the lewd, the woman and the child

Wisdom: شَرُّ الثَّنَاءِ مَا جَرَى عَلَى أَلْسِنَةِ الْأَشْرَارِ
enWisdom: The worst praise is that which flows from the tongues of the wicked

Wisdom: شَرُّ النَّاسِ مَنْ يَخْشَى النَّاسَ فِي رَبِّهِ وَلَا يَخْشَى رَبَّهُ فِي النَّاسِ
enWisdom: The worst person is one who fears the people with regards to [fulfilling the commandments of] his Lord but does not fear his Lord with regards to the people

Wisdom: شَرُّ النَّاسِ مَنْ كَافَى عَلَى الْجَمِيلِ بِالْقَبِيحِ وَخَيْرُ النَّاسِ مَنْ كَافَى عَلَى الْقَبِيحِ بِالْجَمِيلِ
enWisdom: The worst person is one who repays good with evil while the best of people is one who repays evil with good

Wisdom: شَيْئَانِ لَا يُؤْنَفُ مِنْهُمَا الْمَرَضُ وَذُو الْقَرَابَةِ الْمُفْتَقِرُ
enWisdom: There are two things that should not be scorned: sickness and the poor relative

Wisdom: شَرُّ الْأَعْدَاءِ أَبْعَدُهُمْ غَوْراً وَأَخْفَاهُمْ مَكِيدَةً
enWisdom: The worst of enemies is the one who goes to the greatest lengths and is most secretive in his plotting
The necessities of [dire] conditions lower the necks of men

Wisdom: ضَرُورَاتُ الْأَحْوَالِ تَحْمِلُ عَلَى رُكُوبِ الْأَهْوَالِ
enWisdom: The necessities of [dire] conditions take one towards embarking on terrible deeds

Wisdom: طُوبَى لِمَنْ كَانَ لَهُ مِنْ نَفْسِهِ شُغُلٌ شَاغِلٌ وَالنَّاسُ مِنْهُ فِي رَاحَةٍ وَعَمِلَ بِطَاعَةِ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ
enWisdom: Blessed is the one who has in his soul that which keeps him preoccupied [from others] and the people are at ease from him, and who acts in obedience to Allah, the Glorified
When blessings are [openly] displayed, the enviers increase

Wisdom: عَلَيْكُمْ فِي قَضَاءِ حَوَائِجِكُمْ بِكِرَامِ الْأَنْفُسِ وَالْأُصُولِ تُنْجَحْ لَكُمْ عِنْدَهُمْ مِنْ غَيْرِ مِطَالٍ وَلَا مَنٍّ
enWisdom: You must seek the fulfilment of your needs through people of honourable dispositions and origins, you will be successful [in getting what you need] with them, without any delay or any sense of obligation

Wisdom: عَلَيْكُمْ فِي طَلَبِ الْحَوَائِجِ بِشِرَافِ النُّفُوسِ ذَوِي الْأُصُولِ الطَّيِّبَةِ فَإِنَّهَا عِنْدَهُمْ أَقْضَى وَهِيَ لَدَيْكُمْ أَزْكَى
enWisdom: You must seek your needs from those who are honourable and of good origins, for they are more likely to fulfil them [quickly and without obligation] and they are purer in your eyes

Wisdom: عِنْدَ كَثْرَةِ الْعِثَارِ وَالزَّلَلِ تَكْثُرُ الْمَلَامَةُ
enWisdom: When slips and errors increase, reproach increases
The shame of ignominy embitters the sweetness of pleasure

Wisdom: عَيْنُ الْمُحِبِّ عَمِيَّةٌ عَنْ مَعَايِبِ الْمَحْبُوبِ وَأُذُنُهُ صَمَّاءُ عَنْ قُبْحِ مَسَاوِيهِ
enWisdom: The eyes of the lover are blind to the faults of his beloved, and his ears are deaf to the ugliness of his evils
Change your grey hair [by dyeing it] and do not resemble the Jews

Wisdom: غَاضَ الصِّدْقُ فِي النَّاسِ وَفَاضَ الْكِذْبُ وَاسْتُعْمِلَتِ الْمَوَدَّةُ بِاللِّسَانِ وَتَشَاحَنُوا بِالْقُلُوبِ
enWisdom: Truthfulness has diminished among the people and dishonesty has become abundant; love is been expressed by [people with their] tongue while they hate each other with their hearts

Wisdom: فِعْلُ الرِّيبَةِ عَارٌ وَالْوَلُوعُ بِالْغِيبَةِ نَارٌ
enWisdom: Acting suspicious is a shame and having an eager desire to backbite is [a cause of entering] hellfire

Wisdom: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ عِبَادَ اللَّهِ تَقِيَّةَ [تُقَاةَ] مَنْ شَمَّرَ تَجْرِيراً [تَجْرِيداً] وَجَدَّ تَشْمِيراً وَأَكْمَشَ فِي مَهَلٍ وَبَادَرَ عَنْ وَجَلٍ
enWisdom: So be wary of [your duty towards] Allah, O servants of Allah, with the God-wariness of one who tucks up his clothes in preparation [for fulfilling the commandments of Allah] and makes great effort, who acts quickly during the short period [he has] and hurries out of fear [of losing the opportunity]
Sometimes the intended objective may be acquired
At times that which is sought after is attained
A seeker may fail [to achieve what he seeks]
The rigid [and difficult person or issue] may become soft
The one who is precautious may [also at times] get afflicted
At times people are deceived
One who is overly cautious may be destroyed
At times the oppressed are assisted
At times the [one who is] vanquished may gain victory
Sometimes suffering may last [for long]
Sometimes the free man may be treated unjustly
At times the [sharp] sword becomes blunt
At times success may be attained
The healing of a wound may at times lead to disability

Wisdom: قَلِيلٌ يَدُومُ خَيْرٌ مِنْ كَثِيرٍ يَنْقَطِعُ
enWisdom: Little that is continuous is better than a lot that is discontinuous

Wisdom: قَلِيلٌ تَدُومُ عَلَيْهِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ كَثِيرٍ مَمْلُولٍ
enWisdom: Little that is practiced continually is better than [doing] a lot that makes one weary

Wisdom: قَلِيلٌ يَدُومُ خَيْرٌ مِنْ كَثِيرٍ مُنْقَطِعٍ
enWisdom: Little that continues is better than a lot that is discontinuous
Every joy [in this world] turns sour [eventually]
Every wretchedness is [moving] towards ease
Every well-being is [headed] towards affliction
Every person of high rank is envied
Every inaccessible thing is difficult to obtain and seek
Everyone who has been given time [to do good before his death] gives excuses for postponement [of good deeds]

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ عَقْلًا أَنْ يُجْمِلَ فِي مَطَالِبِهِ
enWisdom: It is enough of intelligence for a person to be moderate in his pursuits
Be happy with tribulation and pleased with affliction [as you will gain great reward for it]
Be a helper for the oppressed and an enemy of the oppressor
Be a community that is cried out to so they wake up
For every agony there is a way out
Everything has a way out except [what has been decided by] divine decree
For every gathering there is separation
One who acts irresponsibly regrets
One who tarries lets [the opportunity] go
One who gauges [the people] detests (or keeps away from) [them]
One who confides a lot in others regrets
One who confides less in others is safe

Wisdom: مَنْ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ شَيْ‏ءٍ عُرِفَ بِهِ
enWisdom: One who does too much of something is known by it
One whose attention reduces is [taken unawares and] thrown down
One who plunges into the depths of the sea, drowns
One who suffers the severity of matters, perishes
He who tries to vanquish the one who is above him is overpowered

Wisdom: مَنْ كَثُرَ بَاطِلُهُ لَمْ يُتَّبَعْ حَقُّهُ
enWisdom: One whose falsehood increases, his truth will never be accepted

Wisdom: مَنِ اسْتَعَانَ بِالضَّعِيفِ أَبَانَ عَنْ ضَعْفِهِ
enWisdom: One who seeks assistance from the weak demonstrates his [own] weakness
Whoever is ignorant about people has confidence in them

Wisdom: مَنْ عَرَفَ النَّاسَ لَمْ يَعْتَمِدْ عَلَيْهِمْ
enWisdom: Whoever knows the [true nature of the] people does not rely on them

Wisdom: مَنِ اسْتَعَانَ بِغَيْرِ مُسْتَقِلٍّ ضَيَّعَ أَمْرَهُ
enWisdom: Whoever seeks assistance from one who is not independent has wasted his affair

Wisdom: مَنْ شُكِرَ عَلَى الْإِسَاءَةِ سُخِرَ بِهِ
enWisdom: One who is praised for that which is not in him is ridiculed by it

Wisdom: مَنْ تَأَيَّدَ فِي الْأُمُورِ ظَفِرَ بِبُغْيَتِهِ
enWisdom: One who is supported [by Allah] in his affairs is successful in achieving his goals

Wisdom: مَنْ أَحَدَّ سِنَانَ الْغَضَبِ لِلَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ قَوِيَ عَلى أَشِدَّاءِ الْبَاطِلِ
enWisdom: He who sharpens the spearhead of anger for the sake of Allah acquires the strength to defeat the stalwarts of falsehood

Wisdom: مَنِ احْتَاجَ إِلَيْكَ كَانَتْ طَاعَتُهُ لَكَ بِقَدْرِ حَاجَتِهِ إِلَيْكَ
enWisdom: One who seeks his needs from you, his obedience to you will be to the extent of his need from you

Wisdom: مَنْ شَكَا ضُرَّهُ إِلَى مُؤْمِنٍ فَكَأَنَّمَا شَكَا إِلَى اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ
enWisdom: Whoever complains of his distress to a believer, it is as if he has complained to Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: مَنْ ضَيَّعَهُ الْأَقْرَبُ أُتِيحَ لَهُ الْأَبْعَدُ
enWisdom: One who is neglected by the near one is [made dear to and] supported by the distant [unrelated] one

Wisdom: مَنْ ضَيَّعَ أَمْرَهُ ضَيَّعَ كُلَّ أَمْرٍ
enWisdom: One who neglects his [own] affairs is negligent in all matters

Wisdom: مَنْ رَغِبَ فِيكَ عِنْدَ إِقْبَالِكَ زَهِدَ فِيكَ عِنْدَ إِدْبَارِكَ
enWisdom: One who desires your company when you advance [in rank] wishes to keep away from you when you fall

Wisdom: مَنْ عَرَضَ نَفْسَهُ لِلتُّهَمَةِ فَلَا يَلُومَنَّ مَنْ أَسَاءَ الظَّنَّ بِهِ
enWisdom: hoever exposes himself to suspicion should not blame those who suspect him

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يُخِفْ أَحَداً لَمْ يَخَفْ أَبَداً
enWisdom: One who does not frighten others will never be frightened [by anyone]

Wisdom: مَنْ حَارَبَ النَّاسَ حُورِبَ وَمَنْ أَمِنَ السَّلَبَ سُلِبَ
enWisdom: One who fights against the people will be fought and one who considers himself to be safe from plunder will be plundered

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ تُصْلِحْهُ الْكَرَامَةُ أَصْلَحَتْهُ الْإِهَانَةُ
enWisdom: One who is not reformed by high esteem is reformed by indignity

Wisdom: مَنْ شَهِدَ لَكَ بِالْبَاطِلِ شَهِدَ عَلَيْكَ بِمِثْلِهِ
enWisdom: One who gives false testimony for you will give a similar testimony against you

Wisdom: مَنْ كَانَ نَفْعُهُ فِي مَضَرَّتِكَ لَمْ يَخْلُ فِي كُلِّ حَالٍ مِنْ عَدَاوَتِكَ
enWisdom: One who derives benefit from harming you will never be free from his enmity for you in every situation

Wisdom: مَنْ أَقْعَدَتْهُ نِكَايَةُ الْأَيَّامِ أَقَامَتْهُ مَعُونَةُ الْكِرَامِ
enWisdom: One who is crippled by the hardship of the times is raised by the assistance of the noble-minded ones
Harm comes to the cautious one from his [own] place of security

Wisdom: مِنْ عَلَامَاتِ الشَّقَاءِ الْإِسَاءَةُ إِلَى الْأَخْيَارِ
enWisdom: One of the signs of wretchedness is offending the virtuous

Wisdom: مِنْ كَمَالِ السَّعَادَةِ السَّعْيُ فِي صَلَاحِ [إِصْلَاحِ‏] الْجُمْهُورِ
enWisdom: It is from the perfection of felicity for one to strive for the betterment of the [whole] community

Wisdom: مَا نَالَ الْمَجْدَ مَنْ عَدَاهُ الْحَمْدُ
enWisdom: He who has been forgone by praise will not acquire distinction

Wisdom: مَا أَعْظَمَ وِزْرَ مَنْ طَلَبَ رِضَى الْمَخْلُوقِينَ بِسَخَطِ الْخَالِقِ
enWisdom: How great is the wrongdoing of the one who seeks the pleasure of the creation by angering the Creator
Disputing with the ignoble ones disgraces the [status of the] eminent ones
Revere your elders and your youngsters will revere you
Never do that which would tarnish you with disgrace

Wisdom: لَا تُقْدِمَنَّ عَلَى أَمْرٍ حَتَّى تَخْبُرَهُ
enWisdom: Do not embark on any matter until you have knowledge of it
Do not ask the one from whom you fear deprival
Do not consider yourself safe from an enemy, even if he is grateful
Do not make the nobles desirous of your cruelty [in their favour over those who oppose them]

Wisdom: لَا تُسْرِعْ إِلَى النَّاسِ بِمَا يُكْرَهُونَ فَيَقُولُوا فِيكَ مَا لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
enWisdom: Do not hasten to the people with that which they dislike so that they [begin to] speak about you that which they do not know

Wisdom: لَا تَأْمَنَنَّ مَلُولًا وَإِنْ تَحَلَّى بِالصِّلَةِ فَإِنَّهُ لَيْسَ فِي الْبَرْقِ الْخَاطِفِ مُسْتَمْتَعٌ لِمَنْ يَخُوضُ الظَّلَمَةَ
enWisdom: Never feel secure from the one who is fed-up [with you] even if he is endowed with gifts for indeed there is no enjoyment in lightening for the one who is plunged into darkness

Wisdom: لَا تُنَابِذْ عَدُوَّكَ وَلَا تُقَرِّعْ صَدِيقَكَ وَاقْبَلِ الْعُذْرَ وَإِنْ كَانَ كَذِباً وَدَعِ الْجَوَابَ عَنْ قُدْرَةٍ وَإِنْ كَانَ لَكَ
enWisdom: Do not declare your enmity to your enemy and do not rebuke your friend; and accept the excuse [you are given] even if it is a lie, and do not give [a forceful] response despite having the power to do so, even if it be your right

Wisdom: لَا يَسُوءَنَّكَ مَا يَقُولُ النَّاسُ فِيكَ فَإِنَّهُ إِنْ كَانَ كَمَا يَقُولُونَ كَانَ ذَنْباً عُجِّلَتْ عُقُوبَتُهُ وَإِنْ كَانَ عَلَى خِلَافِ مَا قَالُوا كَانَتْ حَسَنَةً لَمْ تَعْمَلْهَا
enWisdom: Let not what people say about you dishearten you, for indeed if what they say is true then it is a sin whose punishment has been expedited and if it is not true then it is [as] a good deed that you have not performed [but has been recorded in your book of deeds]
There is no honour like eminence
One who is not obeyed has no opinion
The oppressed does not prevail without a helper

Wisdom: لَا يُقِيمُ أَمْرَ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ إِلَّا مَنْ لَا يُصَانِعُ وَلَا يُخَادِعُ وَلَا تَغُرُّهُ الْمَطَامِعُ
enWisdom: The command of Allah, the Glorified, is not established [and executed] except by one who neither corrupts nor beguiles, nor is he deceived by [that which he] desires
